definition: to arrange/to exhibit/to move to and fro/a pendulum
to arrange/to exhibit/to move to and fro/a pendulum

sentences.english: He didn't have a care in the world as he waddled down the street.
sentences.chinese: 他搖搖擺擺走過大街的樣子好像對這個世界毫無牽掛。
鴨子搖搖擺擺地走過去。

sentences.english: The soldiers swung along the street.
sentences.chinese: 士兵們沿路搖搖擺擺地前進。

sentences.english: We shadow the sea with our sails, and reelingly cleave the brine.
sentences.chinese: 將帆影撒在海面上，搖搖擺擺地分開了海水。

sentences.english: The youngsters waddled in a row behind their mother.
sentences.chinese: 在他們母親後面的小年輕慢慢搖搖擺擺走路。

sentences.english: Finally, he is standing on shaking legs.
sentences.chinese: 終於，他搖搖擺擺地站起來了。

sentences.english: Her two-year-old son toddled into the room.
sentences.chinese: 她的兩歲的兒子搖搖擺擺地走進屋裏。

sentences.english: The ducks waddled across the road.
sentences.chinese: 鴨子搖搖擺擺地穿過道路。

sentences.english: The fat man waddled up to her.
sentences.chinese: 那個胖男人搖搖擺擺的向她跑去。

definition: (bird species of China) grey heron (Ardea cinerea)
to take revenge and wipe out a grudge (idiom)
to die (idiom)/to breathe one's last/to give up the ghost
to amuse oneself/to play with/to tease
to run this way and that (idiom); to rush about busily/to bustle about
grinning from ear to ear (idiom)/beaming with happiness
variant of 矇騙|蒙骗[meng1 pian4]
to hold a lamp/to light a lamp
